title: The Phenomenal Work of the January 6th Committee
description:
JOIN TEAM 2020 Victorious! | Communities United supporters (Democrats-Independents-Republicans) from all across the nation to review of the January 6th Select Committee's final investigative report and witness interview transcripts, and discuss key moments from the January 6th Select Committee's eight public hearings and two business meetings. The January 6th Special House Committee has released its final report and transcripts to the public, after eighteen (18) months of investigating the events and causes of the January 6, 2021 Insurrection and Attack at the U.S. Capitol, from more than 1,000 closed-door interviews and 10 public hearings.

__Members of January 6th Select Committee:__ Chairman Bennie Thompson (D-MS), Vice Chair Liz Cheney (R-WY), Rep. Zoe Lofgren (D-CA), Rep. Adam Schiff (D-CA), Rep. Pete Aguilar (D-CA), Rep. Stephanie Murphy (D-FL), Rep. Jamie Raskin (D-MD), Rep. Elaine Luria (D-VA)

__December 31, 2025:__ Register for this J6C-Report meeting discussion date, _when-if_ you are up-to-date with the past J6C-Report readings.  Join the next meeting discussion to learn how to read the J6C-Report effectively-independently on your own.

The J6C-Report reading-discussion has more than two hundred (200+) registrations who meet to bring clarity to the work of the January 6th Committee and the correlation to the national political-legal investigations.

__ADVANCED PREPARATION:__ Review the final report of the J6C to become familiar with the table of contents.  Determine the content matters that pique your interests.  Review the final business meeting video of the J6C.  __The next-past readings with reports-videos are listed below.__  _The occasional-impromptu thirty (30) minute briefings for newcomers and participant updates are scheduled for Friday-Saturday-Sunday._

__Seeking Reviewers-Readers:__ NARRATIVE Chapters 1-8 Review-Readings ... (in sequence or personal choice) [(J6C-report)](https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/23514956-the-full-january-6-committee-report-text) [(video)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5olnF549kNE) [(audible)](https://www.audible.com/pd/The-January-6th-Report-Audiobook/B09Z3CGJ3N)

__Next Meeting Readings:__ The J6C-Report - Referrals to the U.S. Department of Justice Special Counsel and House Ethics Committee (98-118) _determined by attendee-participants_ [(J6C-report)](https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/23514956-the-full-january-6-committee-report-text) [(video)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5olnF549kNE)

The national community meeting discussions will include an ongoing-thorough reading-reflection-review of the January 6th Select Committee Investigative Report and witness interview transcripts.  This is a multiple series discussion with future dates determined by participants.  _Review the registration and distribution to confirm the current chapter reading-discussion._

__Past Meeting Readings:__ The J6C-Report - Forwards by the Speaker of the House, the Chairperson, and the Vice Chairperson (vii-xvii) and the entire Table of Content (xviii-xxiii) for clarity-guidance and direction-understanding, PRELIMINARIES: Recommendations (689-692), Referrals to the U.S. Department of Justice Special Counsel and House Ethics Committee (98-118). [(J6C-report)](https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/23514956-the-full-january-6-committee-report-text) [(video)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5olnF549kNE)

January 6th Committee Business Meeting [(broadcast)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5olnF549kNE) [(broadcast)](https://january6th.house.gov/news/watch-live)

* Introductory Material to the Final Report of the Select Committee.pdf [(report)](https://january6th.house.gov/report-executive-summary)
* Final Report of the Select Committee.pdf [(REPORT)](https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/23514956-the-full-january-6-committee-report-text) [(report)](https://january6th.house.gov/sites/democrats.january6th.house.gov/files/Report_FinalReport_Jan6SelectCommittee.pdf)
* Witness Interview Transcripts [(20221221)](https://january6th.house.gov/news/press-releases/release-select-committee-materials) [(20221223)](https://thehill.com/homenews/house/3787187-jan-6-panel-releases-transcripts-for-46-additional-witness-testimonies/) [(20221227)]() [(20221229)]() [(20221230-ALL)](https://www.axios.com/2022/12/29/jan-6-committee-latest-transcript-interviews)
* United States House Select Committee on the January 6 Attack [(chronology)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_House_Select_Committee_on_the_January_6_Attack)

__Mission of January 6th Select Committee__

Whereas January 6, 2021, was one of the darkest days of our democracy, during which insurrectionists attempted to impede Congress’s Constitutional mandate to validate the presidential election and launched an assault on the United States Capitol Complex that resulted in multiple deaths, physical harm to over 140 members of law enforcement, and terror and trauma among staff, institutional employees, press, and Members;

Whereas, on January 27, 2021, the Department of Homeland Security issued a National Terrorism Advisory System Bulletin that due to the “heightened threat environment across the United States,” in which “[S]ome ideologically-motivated violent extremists with objections to the exercise of governmental authority and the presidential transition, as well as other perceived grievances fueled by false narratives, could continue to mobilize to incite or commit violence.” [(mission ...)](https://january6th.house.gov/about)

__Conclusions of January 6th Select Committee:__ The January 6th Committee released its final report on Thursday, December 22, 2022. The 845-page report details the key players, narratives, meetings, and events that led to the violent attack on the U.S. Capitol Building and American democracy which attempted to prevent the certification of the presidential election in the year 2021.  The 845-page final report of the committee draws on testimony from hundreds of witnesses and thousands of hours of video footage which identifies the key players involved in the attack on the U.S. Capitol Building, the Congress, the Constitution and made recommendations on how to prevent such an attack in the future.

January 6th Committee Business Meeting [(broadcast)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5olnF549kNE) [(broadcast)](https://january6th.house.gov/news/watch-live) — The committee met on Monday, December 19, 2022 to vote to approve the final report, with a decision to make criminal referrals to the U.S. Department of Justice as part of its probe.

WARNING: The videos may include graphic or disturbing depictions of violence. [(video)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YtwItbTPWNE)
Past Hearings [(C-SPAN)](https://www.c-span.org/search/?sdate=&edate=&congressSelect=&yearSelect=&searchtype=Videos&sort=Most+Recent+Event&text=0&sponsorid%5B%5D=139816&formatid%5B%5D=26) [(video)](https://january6th.house.gov/legislation/hearings)
Final Business Meeting [(video)](https://january6th.house.gov/)

title: Volunteer Orientation: Unlock Your Impact!
description:
**Welcome to the Food & Water Volunteer Network!** 

Our team of incredible volunteers is working across the country to win real change to protect our food, water and climate.

Join us for an Orientation Call to get trained on how to take effective action. We hold these meetings once a month and it's a chance to meet other volunteers, learn how to make an impact, and get to work right away.

**Are you new here?**

This is the event for you! We'll give an orientation to volunteering with Food & Water Action and help you get started right away to take action. We can't wait to meet you!

title: Kingston Calls + Cocoa
description:
Imagine that someone calls you. They tell you about the new rights that you have as a tenant because tenants (just like you) fought for and WON a law called Good Cause Eviction. Then, they tell you about the plan they have to replace Central Hudson with a publicly owned utility company so that your electric bills go down and invite you to be a part of it... You'd probably be pretty happy they called, right?! 

On Thursday night, we're going to be the ones calling to share the good news. 

Our phonebanking objective varies based on what we want to mobilize people around. Right now we're focusing on letting tenants know about their protections under ETPA/GCE (don't worry if you don't know what these abbreviations mean!), the Hudson Valley Power Authority, and HR9495. 

We have a script, we have the phone numbers to call, and we have a training so that you'll have everything you need to have great conversations. Plus, we'll have hot cocoa waiting for you!

***Please bring a laptop, phone, and headphones***

title: 2020 Victorious! MLK National Action-Impact-Service | Communities United
description:
JOIN 2020 Victorious! | Communities United supporters from all across the nation for the MLK National Action-Impact-Service!  We honor the legacy of the Reverend Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. with a demand for legislative action.  This is democracy and it requires action.

In 1968, Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and civil rights leaders called for a “revolution of values” in America.  Learn about the origination of "The Poor People's Campaign" and ten (10) surprising facts about the civil rights leader.

__“Life’s most persistent and urgent question is: ‘What are you doing for others?'” – The Reverend Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.__

We have to all work together towards a 21st-Century America in which we all benefit and can all be proud of.  While we reflect on the past and look towards the future with hope and intention, the MLK National Action-Impact-Service will be an analysis of our national history and future legacy.

Join us as we criss-cross the nation from New York to California, from Florida to Texas, from Washington, DC to the State of Washington (east-west, north-south) to honor the successes-triumphs of the Reverend Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.  We want you to bring your favorite relevant historical civil rights and social justice topics and your best community service ideas to the discussion.

2020 Victorious! | Communities United is excited to partner with organizations across the country to participate in a National Action-Impact-Service in honor of the Reverend Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.  2020 Victorious! | Communities United encourages volunteers and community leaders to host virtual or socially distant service events in their community.

Copyright © 2021-2024 Communities United | 2020 Victorious!

title: Compost Hub Support: Carver Middle School

address_lines: McKinley Ave & E 46th St, Los Angeles, CA 90011

description:
At our Compost Hubs, food scraps collected from the community are transformed into nutrient-rich compost, and we need your help to make it happen! As a Compost Hub Support Volunteer, you’ll gain hands-on experience working alongside our knowledgeable Compost Managers. Get ready to leave feeling accomplished, a little sweaty, and brimming with new compost knowledge. 

#### ABOUT ACTIVITY:
Roll up your sleeves and dive into a variety of engaging activities—whether it’s managing a three-bin system, tending to a compost pile, sifting finished compost, or exploring a mix of everything. There’s something for everyone, from beginners to seasoned pros! Plus, our Compost Hubs are situated in LA County’s most cherished green spaces: community gardens, urban farms, and beautiful parks. Join passionate community composters, learn to turn food scraps into rich compost, and connect with the local food system. 

#### MORE INFO: 
* You will be working outdoors! Shade levels vary by site.
* Activities level can be adjusted to your comfort and abilities—just communicate with your Compost Manager.
* No prior composting experience is needed; everyone is welcome!
* This location has bathrooms available
* If you sign up, we ask that you show up! We rely on volunteers, like you, to achieve our mission.  
* We’ll follow up with details via email, so be sure to provide your best contact email when signing up.

#### AGE REQUIREMENT:
This volunteer activity is best suited for volunteers aged 16 and up. Minors under the age of 16 should come accompanied by a parent or guardian unless other arrangements are made. Contact ashleigh@lacompost.org for more information.

#### IMPORTANT: VOLUNTEER WAIVER
Please make sure you have signed the volunteer waiver. 
Access the e-wavier at https://www.lacompost.org/waiver

title: GenVote Movement Welcome Call!
description:
Welcome to Generation Vote! We are the only national youth-led electoral justice organization that is sparking an intersectional youth-led movement that fights for our right to vote and a just democracy for all.

Following the defeat of the "red wave" during the 2022 midterm election, politicians have aggressively shifted their attention to state legislatures in a continued attempt to thwart our democracy. These efforts are being funded by the very same mega-wealthy donors and corporations who are blocking progress on issues that our generation cares about, such as climate justice or student loan debt relief. In order to ensure real progress we must have a just democracy for all. 

There’s no doubt about it: In 2025, the anti-democracy movement will do everything within its power to silence the most diverse generation that our country has ever seen - US. 

But just like a phoenix, we will rise from the ashes of our broken democracy in order to create a government that reflects our diverse communities and transform what is possible in our homes, schools, places of worship and workplaces. We believe that it's up to our generation to achieve a truly multiracial and just democracy for all people in this country.

Can you feel it? The power of a just democracy? Because we can.

Join us for a 1-hour welcome call to connect with young folks from across the country, learn more about our movement strategy, and find out how to plug-into the movement.

 

Accessibility Information

Live captioning can be provided during the call. Have additional accessibility questions? Reply to your registration email to confirm your requirements or request more information.

title: EDF Action MI Environmental Book Club
description:
**Join us the second Saturday of each month for our environmental & climate activist book club!**

BOOK CLUB 2025 

January 11th: [Documentary] Living the Change: Inspiring Stories for a Sustainable Future (Free Full Documentary)

February 8th:  [Book] No is Not Enough, by Naomi Klein (Available on amazon, Hoopla, local library)

March 8th: [Book] The Language of Climate Politics, by Genevieve Guenther (available on amazon, Hoopla and local library)

April 12th:  [Book] Silent Spring - Rachel Carson 
Let’s revisit the book that started our book club AND the environmental movement! 

May 10th: [Podcast] How to save a planet - listen to a few episodes and come to the meeting to share what you learned. (https://gimletmedia.com/shows/howtosaveaplanet/episodes#show-tab-picker) find it on spotify:  https://open.spotify.com/show/1KzrasExlM5dgMYwgFHns6

June 14th: [Book] It’s not that Radical | climate action to transform our world - Mikaela Loach

July 12th: [Documentary]: Climate extremes (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U8pLrRkqbb0)

August 9th:   [Book] Earth for All, by Sandrine Dixson Decleve (available on Amazon)

September 13th:  [Book] What if We Get it Right, by Ayana Elizabeth Johnson (Available in book and audio on Amazon)

October 11th:  [Podcast] Climate Rising (https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/a-preview-of-cop29-what-business-leaders-should/id1482781075?i=1000675873770)

November 8th:  [Book] The Good Ancestor, by Roman Krznaric (available on Amazon and Hoopla audio)

December 13th: Year end wrap up - what did we learn? 2026 Book Club 



******************************
[PREVIOUS:  FOR REFERENCE ONLY] 2024 Book Club Selections:  

JANUARY 13th: Saving Us by Katherine Hayhoe 
FEBRUARY 10th: Superman's not coming by Erin Brockovich
MARCH 9th: Down to Earth with Zac Efron (Documentary)
APRIL 13th: Madhouse Effect by Michael Mann
MAY	11th: Disasterology by Dr. Samantha Montano
JUNE 8th: The Climate Book by Greta Thunberg
JULY 13th: Gather (2020) (Documentary)
AUGUST 10th	How to Talk to a Science Denier by Lee McIntyre, Eric Michael Summerer, et al.
SEPTEMBER 14th: The Rights of Nature by David Boyd
OCTOBER 12th:  A Future we can Love by Susan Bauer Wu
NOVEMBER 9th: Anthropocene: The Human Epoch (2018) (Documentary)
DECEMBER 14th: Year-end discussion + 2025 book list

title: Food Scraps Collection: Atwater Village Farmers' Market
description:
As a volunteer, you’ll be right in the action, collecting food scraps from market-goers—the first step in a crucial process that turns waste into nutrient-rich compost. These scraps, gathered at local markets, are then processed at nearby green parks or gardens. Throughout your shift, you'll be guided by an experienced LA Compost staff member, who will act as your Compost Manager, offering insights and helping you share the benefits of composting with the public. The best part is during your volunteer shift, you can take some time to shop the market. Join us and be part of the composting movement that's transforming LA—one food scrap at a time!

#### ABOUT ACTIVITY:
As a volunteer, you’ll play a hands-on role in guiding market-goers through composting, ensuring their food scraps are clean of stickers, compostable, and ready to be turned into nutrient-rich compost. You’ll monitor for contamination, assist with tracking data, and serve as a friendly, welcoming host to our composting community. 

#### MORE INFO: 
* You'll be stationed at the LA Compost booth under a pop-up canopy within the farmers' market. There will also be seating available.
* You may be asked to assist with moving filled bins of material weighing 60+ pounds. We always offer team lifts; you will never be asked to lift bins if you prefer not to.
* No prior composting experience is needed; everyone is welcome!
* Bathrooms are available. 
* If you sign up, please show up! We rely on volunteers like you to achieve our mission.  
* We’ll follow up with details via email, so be sure to provide your best contact email when signing up.

#### AGE REQUIREMENT:
This volunteer activity is best suited for volunteers aged 16 and up. Minors under 16 should come accompanied by a parent or guardian unless other arrangements are made. Contact ashleigh@lacompost.org for more information.

#### IMPORTANT: VOLUNTEER WAIVER
Please make sure you have signed the volunteer waiver. 
Access the e-wavier at https://www.lacompost.org/waiver

description:

These scraps, gathered, are then processed at nearby green parks or gardens. Throughout your shift, you'll be guided by an experienced LA Compost staff member, who will act as your Compost Manager, offering insights and helping you share the benefits of composting with the public.  Join us and be part of the composting movement that's transforming LA—one food scrap at a time!

#### ABOUT ACTIVITY:
As a volunteer, you’ll play a hands-on role in guiding community members through dropping off, ensuring their food scraps are clean of stickers and ready to be turned into nutrient-rich compost. You’ll monitor for contamination, assist with tracking data, and serve as a friendly, welcoming host to our composting community. 

#### MORE INFO:  
* You'll be stationed at the LA Compost booth under a pop-up canopy within the farmers' market. There will also be seating available.
* You may be asked to assist with moving filled bins of material weighing 60+ pounds. We always offer team lifts; you will never be asked to lift bins if you prefer not to.
* No prior composting experience is needed; everyone is welcome!

* If you sign up, please show up! We rely on volunteers like you to achieve our mission.

#### AGE REQUIREMENT:
This volunteer activity is best suited for volunteers aged 16 and up. Minors under 16 should come accompanied by a parent or guardian unless other arrangements are made. Contact ashleigh@lacompost.org for more information.

#### Location History:
This collection location is not at a farmers' market! Amidst the height of the pandemic in March 2020, we paused farmers' market collections to allow for greater social distancing. We moved about a mile away from the Atwater Village Farmers' Market to right outside the Elysian Valley Community Garden. This location was so popular that we decided to stay even after it was safe to return to the market again.

description:
Join us for our monthly meeting!

The Hancock County Democratic Party meets monthly on the 2nd Monday from 7:00p - 8:00p at the Hancock Historical Museum at 422 W. Sandusky St.

title: District 2 (Cocoa/Rockledge/Merritt Island/Cape Canaveral/Cocoa Beach) Monthly Meeting

location.venue: Unitarian Universalist Fellowship of Central Brevard

description:
Come and join us as we have a potluck together, build community, share ideas, and talk through concerns. Meet fellow Democrats (and left leaning unaffiliated voters) for community and conversation. We review and implement the action plans to put Democrats in office at the local, state and national level. Our focus is on building neighborhood teams with feet-on-the ground to engage with voters in our own communities and encourage them to cast their ballots, request the option to vote by mail and stay engaged on the issues. Let's 'Do Something!'.

Not sure if you're in District 2? Check here: [District 2 Map]( https://www.votebrevard.gov/Portals/Brevard/Documents/Maps/Districts/CountyCommission/New_CountyComm2.pdf)

title: A Pint of Politics and Doing Something Second Sundays
description:
Second Sundays - A Pint of Politics and #DoingSomething

Join INDIVISIBLE Sacramento, Sister District Sacramento, the Coalition Against Project 2025 at our favorite local eatery and Coalition Partner, Oak Park Brewing Co. We meet on the 2nd Sundays and will provide unique ways to take action each month.

2-4 pm   
We meet rain or shine on the outside patio!

**April 13 Activities** At this Pint of Politics, we will review the state of play, introduce you to our activities - lobbying, postcards, phonebanks, protests, coalition and community building, grassroots organizing, and getting connected to our network to find your happy place.

**Bring Donations of Tarps and Socks** We are collecting donations for our unhoused neighbors with the Poor People's Campaign and the Community Lead Advocacy Program.

We'll continue to meet the 2nd Sundays in 2025 and add more as necessary.

**By signing up to this event, you will be added to the Indivisible Sacramento newsletter to get regular updates about our events and activities. You will be able to unsubscribe at any time.**

Please check out our webpage at https://indivisiblesacramento.com/ and our other current events on our Linktree at https://linktr.ee/indivisiblesac.

title: Run Local Training
description:
Are you a Democrat running for local office here in Maine? Or even thinking about running for local office? Check out this free, live, online training on how to run a winning local campaign! This training covers important topics like: direct voter contact, signs, mail, and letters to letters-to-the-editor. Any Maine Democrat can sign up! Note, these trainings are intended for Maine candidates and volunteers only and not for folks in other states.

Please be sure to sign up at least an hour before the training begins to ensure that you receive the Zoom meeting info on time.

title: Monthly status (zoom) followed by letter/postcard writing on your own
description:
This monthly status update event is on ZOOM.  It will be followed by letter/postcard writing on your own.  There are separate events to attend in-person letter/postcard writing at multiple locations. 

March was spent writing Vote Forward letters to WI for their state supreme court special election on 4/1.

April and May will be writing postcards to registered voters of color in VA before the primary election with the Center for Common Ground and their Reclaim Our Vote campaign. 
 
June will be writing GOTV postcards to VA with the Progressive Turnout Project.  

July through October we expect to have Vote Forward letters to VA.

The evening will start with a 10-15 minute status update. 
The April and May presentation will include Swing Left's 3 to Win strategy to take back the House in 2026.

Then  we'll dive into writing letters/postcards. You can stay on zoom to be connected to the in-person meetings or drop off and write at your own pace.

How to get your postcards:
Through The working Circle for the Center for Common Ground (these go fast):
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScyrmMKGCBNkMIsdSTBgW1Tp9o8y5VsyfZNhPR-Gs9nIw12Rw/viewform?usp=sharing

Through the Center for Common Ground and their Reclaim Our Vote postcard campaigns (very specific instructions):
https://www.centerforcommonground.org
https://www.centerforcommonground.org/reclaim-our-vote
 
For the Progressive Turnout Project:
turnoutpac.org
You will need 1-4 weeks to prepare for June.

How to get your VOTE FORWARD letters:
Sign up as a volunteer on Vote Forward at votefwd.org/swingleft. It takes a day or so to get approved as a volunteer, so plan to sign up 3-4 days ahead of the event.
Download 20 letters to write at the event and gather your materials. You will need 20 first class stamps, a blue pen, and 20 #10 business envelopes. Swing Left’s “Write Letters from Home” page has step-by-step information to help you get set up on Vote Forward and download letters, including a short video.



and now the small print:
Join me to learn about building grassroots power for all the fights to come. Together, we can defeat the anti-democratic movement within the Republican party, dismantle the GOP's advantage in key swing states, and maintain and expand Democratic power at the federal level. 

If you haven’t heard of it, Swing Left is a national network that helps people find high impact ways to support Democratic candidates. We focus on the most flippable races as an important step towards ensuring the progressive change needed to create a more inclusive and equitable government and society.

If postcards: We'll have the postcards, addresses, and Stick-on labels with election information. They encourage people to use multiple colors of pens to make the postcards more eye-catching.  And bring 20 postcard stamps ($0.56).




and now the small print:
Join me for a letter writing party, where we'll be writing letters using an award-winning, proven tactic to reach potential voters in important upcoming elections.

RSVP here, and we’ll let you know how to join this party. Invite your friends, too and let them know that Swing Left is pioneering an innovative program, using letters to help volunteers like us turn out voters through our letter-writing affiliate, Vote Forward.

Think about it: if you help get a voter to the polls, that is an important step towards creating a more inclusive and equitable government and society. Looking forward to seeing you!

title: The 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)
description:
__The 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development,__ calls on countries to begin efforts to achieve the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) during the 15 years between the years 2015 through 2030. The goals address the needs of people in both developed and developing countries, emphasizing that no one should be left behind. Broad and ambitious in scope, the Agenda addresses the three dimensions of sustainable development: social, economic and environmental, as well as important aspects related to peace, justice and effective institutions.

__December 31, 2025:__ Register for this 17-SDGs meeting discussion date, _when-if_ you are up-to-date with the past 17-SDGs readings.  Join the next meeting discussion to learn how to read the 17-SDGs effectively-independently on your own.

__The 17 Sustainable Development Goals [(SDGs)](https://sdgs.un.org/goals)__ build on the eight  Millennium Development Goals (MDGs), which specifically sought by 2015: to eradicate extreme poverty and hunger; achieve universal primary education; promote gender equality and empower women; reduce child mortality; improve maternal health; combat HIV/AIDS, malaria and other diseases; ensure environmental sustainability; and develop a global partnership for development.

__Do you know all 17 SDGs?__ [(video)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0XTBYMfZyrM&t=84s)
“They are a to-do list for people and planet, and a blueprint for success,” of the 17 goals and 169 targets to wipe out poverty, fight inequality and tackle climate change over the next 15 years between the years 2015 through 2030.

“The seventeen Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) are our shared vision of humanity and a social contract between the world’s leaders and the people,” UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon said of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development adopted unanimously by 193 Heads of State and other top leaders at a summit at UN Headquarters in New York in September 2015.

But progress has been uneven across regions and countries, leaving millions of people behind, especially the poorest and those disadvantaged due to sex, age, disability, ethnicity or geographic location. Targeted efforts will be needed to reach the most vulnerable people.

This is where the SDGs are expected to play a part. They stress everything from zero poverty, zero hunger, good health, quality education, gender equality, clean water and sanitation, and affordable clean energy, to decent work and economic growth, innovation, reduced inequalities, sustainable cities, responsible consumption, climate action, unpolluted oceans and land, and partnerships to achieve the goals.

title: Special Presentation: Juneteenth: Faith & Freedom | A Documentary | Communities United
description:
__Welcome to 2020 Victorious! | Communities United.__  We are building a grassroots organization-team of civic-social activists, community organizers, campaign volunteers and better informed citizens to lead the effort-initiatives in their respective regions-states and local communities and to educate-empower more people with accurate information-knowledge.  The intent is to equip all member-participants to be effective community leaders-organizers and have a more widespread, impactful voice within more of the nation's most affected communities.

- - - - -

__Special Presentation:__ 2020 Victorious! | Communities United for a nationwide virtual screening of __Juneteenth: Faith & Freedom | A Documentary__ from @ourdailybread Voices Collection. – Sunday+Monday, June 18+19, 2023 10:00pm-11:30pm ET / 7:00pm-8:30pm PT and Sunday, June 25, 2023 8:00pm-10:00pm ET / 5:00pm-7:00pm PT. [(documentary trailer)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xa4txHtKIps)

* Join after the Democracy Matters! | JUNETEENTH Voter Education-Registration-Empowerment | Communities United [(juneteenth)](https://www.mobilize.us/2020victorious/event/564618/).

This documentary film is a powerful 75-minute presentation which sheds light on the original Juneteenth experience and the continued-ongoing expansion of democracy and freedoms within the American civil rights and social justice system.  The documentary introduces ways to help bring the civil rights and social justice system into alignment with democracy.

Uncover the deep spiritual significance of America’s newest federal holiday with pastor Rasool Berry in "Juneteenth: Faith & Freedom," a new documentary film presented by the Our Daily Bread Voices Collection and Our Daily Bread Media.  Learn how Scripture inspired the faith of enslaved people, travel to the church where America’s first Juneteenth celebration took place, and uncover why newly liberated men and women credited God for their freedom.

With special guests Ms. Opal Lee, Lecrae, and more, you’ll journey to Galveston, Texas to discover a faith stronger than suffering.

- - - - -

__"Juneteenth: Faith & Freedom | A Documentary"__ exposes how America’s history of enslavement and social injustice evolved into an enormous movement for civil rights and social justice empowerment. Through first-person accounts of those charged with guarding the history of Juneteenth in Galveston, Texas under the paralleled stories about the systems of today, the film brings to light a powerful imagery of racial inequality. With the emergence of the Black Lives Matter movement, this film provides historical context and examines America’s history of racist oppression.

[A black man is troubled by the legacy of American slavery and the misuse of Christianity to justify it. He travels throughout Texas and discovers how the Juneteenth holiday reveals a resilient hope that empowered the formerly enslaved and their descendants to fight for freedom in an often unjust society.]

- - - - -

By joining the 2020 Victorious | Communities United team, you will receive access to (i) regular updates on the latest political action news, (ii) invites to regional-state-local programs-events that directly impact the community, government and the nation, and (iii) relevant educational training to provide the information-knowledge to be effective within your region-states and local communities.

 __Worth Repeating:__ The intent is to equip all member-participants to be effective community leaders-organizers and have a more widespread, impactful voice within more of the nation's most affected communities.

Copyright © 2021-2023 Communities United | 2020 Victorious!

title: Monitor GA Election Boards! Peanut Gallery new volunteer training
description:
Join us on the 3rd Tuesday of the month at 6:00PM to learn how you can help protect Georgia’s election structure as a Peanut Gallery Volunteer Monitor!

The Georgia Peanut Gallery is a state-wide election board monitoring program focused on observing and reporting on the activities and decisions made by election boards in our 159 counties.

The training will cover the history and present day landscape of voter suppression in Georgia and give you the tools and information you need to be an effective Board of Elections monitor.

We are working to monitor every county Board of Elections in Georgia and contact them often because things change fast these days. We look for polling location changes, issues with poll workers and anything that could impact access to voting. We update the Georgia Peanut Gallery Blog and social media regularly to keep the public informed.

Hope you can join us this month.

title: Compost Hub Support: Arlington Garden in Pasadena
description:
At our Compost Hubs, food scraps collected from the community are transformed into nutrient-rich compost, and we need your help to make it happen! As a Compost Hub Support Volunteer, you’ll gain hands-on experience working alongside our knowledgeable Compost Managers. Get ready to leave feeling accomplished, a little sweaty, and brimming with new compost knowledge. 

#### ABOUT ACTIVITY:
Roll up your sleeves and dive into a variety of engaging activities—whether it’s managing a three-bin system, tending to a compost pile, sifting finished compost, or exploring a mix of everything. There’s something for everyone, from beginners to seasoned pros! Plus, our Compost Hubs are situated in LA County’s most cherished green spaces: community gardens, urban farms, and beautiful parks. Join passionate community composters, learn to turn food scraps into rich compost, and connect with the local food system. 

#### MORE INFO: 
* You will be working outdoors! Shade levels vary by site.
* Activities level can be adjusted to your comfort and abilities—just communicate with your Compost Manager.
* No prior composting experience is needed; everyone is welcome!
* There is an outdoor porta-potty available. 
* If you sign up, we ask that you show up! We rely on volunteers, like you, to achieve our mission.  
* We’ll follow up with details via email, so be sure to provide your best contact email when signing up.

#### AGE REQUIREMENT:
This volunteer activity is best suited for volunteers aged 16 and up. Minors under the age of 16 should come accompanied by a parent or guardian unless other arrangements are made. Contact ashleigh@lacompost.org for more information.

#### IMPORTANT: VOLUNTEER WAIVER
Please make sure you have signed the volunteer waiver. 
Access the e-wavier at https://www.lacompost.org/waiver

title: Progressive Issues Activism - Rapid Response for Our Freedoms
description:
Are you alarmed by the far-right's **relentless push to dismantle our democracy** and undermine our future? The *time to act is now*—your voice and involvement are vital in this critical moment.

Together, we have the power to **resist this dangerous agenda** that seeks to replace our democracy with authoritarian rule. By organizing, mobilizing, and holding leaders accountable, we can **protect the rights, freedoms, and values that define America.**

Join us for **"Rapid Response for Our Freedoms,"** a crucial event where we **stand as one to defend democracy**, *uphold the rule of law,* and safeguard the **rights and freedoms we all hold dear.** 

*This is our moment to rise up* for an America that includes everyone when we say *"liberty and justice for all," * not just the wealthy and powerful.

### Goals of the Event:

-To **mobilize and activate** a network of people ready to take **immediate, strategic action** to defend our *rights, freedoms, the rule of law, and democracy.*

-To **educate and inform** participants about current *authoritarian threats, legal overreach, and* **coordinated attacks on our freedoms.**

-To share **concrete tools, tactics, and next steps** that individuals and groups can take in their communities to *push back.*

-To build a **connected movement** rooted in *collective power, solidarity, and a shared vision of justice and equality for all*—not just the wealthy, powerful, or those with privilege.

### What You'll Take Away: 

-A **clear understanding** of the threats we face—and the *power we have to overcome them.*

-**Action steps** you can take *immediately* to protect our rights, freedoms, the rule of law, and democracy.

-**Resources** for organizing *locally and nationally* with other committed members of People Power United.

-A **renewed sense of purpose, community, and hope**—knowing *you're not alone* in this fight.

The strength of **people power is unstoppable**—together, *we can and will make a difference.*

At **People Power United**, we believe in **progress** and the strength of **collective action**. Together, we can push back against extremism and **build a brighter future.** Join us in the fight for **Freedom over Fascism** and help *amplify the power of people* to shape our democracy!

title: Postcards and Letter writing to voters
description:
Together, we have the power to inspire voters and create real change—one vote at a time.

Join us to learn about our impactful postcard and letter-writing program, designed to boost voter turnout in critical, high-stakes elections across the nation. No supplies are needed—just bring your passion! During this session, we’ll guide you through the process and share updates on our current campaigns targeting key races.

From there, we’ll take our efforts into our neighborhoods, engaging family, friends, and community members to join us in writing postcards and letters that connect with voters and encourage them to take action.

At People Power United, we believe in progress and the strength of collective action. Together, we can push back against extremism and build a brighter future. Join us in the fight for Freedom over Fascism and help amplify the power of people to shape our democracy!

title: OR: Food & Water Team Oregon Volunteer Meetings
description:
Join us at our monthly volunteer meeting for updates on campaign issues, conversations about updates in Oregon, and for more opportunities to get involved in the fight against factory farming!

Factory Farms are moving into Oregon, polluting our air and water, jeopardizing the health of nearby communities, pushing out independent family farmers, and speeding up the climate crisis. We are fighting back!

We will also:

- Share important updates for our factory farm moratorium campaign

- Discuss upcoming volunteer opportunities and how you can help!

Whether you’ve never taken part in an advocacy campaign or are a seasoned activist, join us to jump into action!

What We Believe

- We all deserve a healthy and livable environment.
- We all deserve justice; people of all races, religions, genders, and sexual orientations deserve fair treatment and equitable opportunities and outcomes.
- We all deserve human dignity and to have our basic needs met.
- We all deserve economic fairness; let’s support the many, not the few.
- We all deserve real democracy; our votes and voices can’t be defeated by corporate money.

**FAMILY-FRIENDLY.** Kids are welcome at our meetings and the library is open until our meeting ends at 8pm. If your children can occupy themselves independently, they can read in the library while you join our meeting.

You can also support our efforts by [making a donation!](https://secure.actblue.com/donate/warwickdemspa?refcode=mobilize)

- **Primary Election:** Tuesday, May 20

**Please make sure to enter your correct phone number and email address.** Your RSVP on this page is not final—we'll be in touch closer to Election Day to discuss what hours and polling place you'd like to volunteer for and answer any questions you may have.

You can also support our efforts on Election Day by [making a donation!](https://secure.actblue.com/donate/warwickdemspa?refcode=mobilize)

title: Food Scraps Collection: LA River Farmers' Market
description:
As a volunteer, you’ll be right in the action, collecting food scraps from market-goers—the first step in a crucial process that turns waste into nutrient-rich compost. These scraps, gathered at local markets, are then processed at nearby green parks or gardens. Throughout your shift, you'll be guided by an experienced LA Compost staff member, who will act as your Compost Manager, offering insights and helping you share the benefits of composting with the public. The best part is that during your volunteer shift, you can take some time to shop at the market. Join us and be part of the composting movement that's transforming LA—one food scrap at a time!

#### ABOUT ACTIVITY:
As a volunteer, you’ll play a hands-on role in guiding market-goers through composting, ensuring their food scraps are clean of stickers, compostable, and ready to be turned into nutrient-rich compost. You’ll monitor for contamination, assist with tracking data, and serve as a friendly, welcoming host to our composting community. 

#### MORE INFO: 
* You'll be stationed at the LA Compost booth under a pop-up canopy within the farmers' market. There will also be seating available.
* You may be asked to assist with moving filled bins of material weighing 60+ pounds. We always offer team lifts; you will never be asked to lift bins if you prefer not to.
* No prior composting experience is needed; everyone is welcome!
* There is a porta potty on site
* If you sign up, please show up! We rely on volunteers like you to achieve our mission.  
* We’ll follow up with details via email, so be sure to provide your best contact email when signing up.

#### AGE REQUIREMENT:
This volunteer activity is best suited for volunteers aged 16 and up. Minors under 16 should come accompanied by a parent or guardian unless other arrangements are made. Contact ashleigh@lacompost.org for more information.

#### IMPORTANT: VOLUNTEER WAIVER
Please make sure you have signed the volunteer waiver. 
Access the e-wavier at https://www.lacompost.org/waiver

title: D10 Neighborhood Beautification Day (Bayview / Dogpatch)
description:
Join San Francisco Public Works for a day of greening and neighborhood pride in District 10 (Potrero Hill, Dogpatch, Bayview, and more).

Our goal is to plant 75 trees in 1 day and we need your help! Volunteers will be assigned to 7-12 worksites and plant street trees in District 10. 

There will be 1-3 worksites where volunteers will garden, mulch, or pick up litter. The projects and tasks will be different, depending on the site and community group's requests. This event will happen rain-or-shine.  

### What to Expect
- The event kicks off at Bayview K.C. Jones Playground lawn (1601 Armstrong Ave) with registration between 8:30 AM and 9 AM. 
- We’ll hold a short speaking program to go over the day’s activities and get a quick safety overview. 
- Volunteers and Public Works staff then will head to their assigned work sites.
- Work will take place for about 3 hours, with everyone returning to the kickoff location around noon.
- Lunch will be served to volunteers at the end. 

### What to Wear/Bring
- Dress in layers
- Wear closed toe shoes and sunscreen
- Bring a reusable water bottle to stay hydrated

### Community Partners 
San Francisco Public Works, Elected Officials, San Francisco Recreation and Parks Department

title: Columbia IN-PERSON letter/postcard writing to Voters with SwingLeftHoCoMD
description:
This event is ONLY for IN-PERSON letter/postcard writing attendees. There is a separate zoom event for a monthly status update and letter/postcard writing on your own.

March was spent writing Vote Forward letters to WI for their state supreme court special election on 4/1.

April and May will be writing postcards to registered voters of color in VA before the primary election with the Center for Common Ground and their Reclaim Our Vote campaign.  If you want to learn more about the Center for Common Ground and their Reclaim Our Vote postcard campaigns here are the links:
https://www.centerforcommonground.org
https://www.centerforcommonground.org/reclaim-our-vote


June will be writing GOTV postcards to VA with the Progressive Turnout Project.  

July through October we expect to have Vote Forward letters to VA.

The evening will start with a 10-15 minute status update. The April presentation will include Swing Left's 3 to Win strategy to take back the House in 2026. 

Then we'll dive into writing. 
If letters: We'll have the letters printed. You bring a blue pen, 20 envelopes, and 20 first class stamps.
If postcards: We'll have the postcards, addresses, and Stick-on labels with election information. They encourage people to use multiple colors of pens to make the postcards more eye-catching.  And bring 20 postcard stamps ($0.56).




and now for the small print:
Join me for a letter writing party, where we'll be writing letters using an award-winning, proven tactic to reach potential voters in important upcoming elections.

RSVP here, and we’ll let you know how to join this party. Invite your friends, too and let them know that Swing Left is pioneering an innovative program, using letters to help volunteers like us turn out voters through our letter-writing affiliate, Vote Forward.

Think about it: if you help get a voter to the polls, that is an important step towards creating a more inclusive and equitable government and society. Looking forward to seeing you!

title: Democracy Matters! | JUNETEENTH Voter Education-Registration-Empowerment | Communities United
description:
JOIN DEMOCRACY MATTERS! supporters from all across the nation for Juneteenth, a day to celebrate freedom, culture, and progress. Juneteenth marks the end of slavery in America and commemorates the collective freedom of African-Americans.  Celebrated annually on June 19th, Juneteenth honors the date that 250,000 enslaved Texans learned that their freedom had been secured by the Emancipation Proclamation – two full years after it was signed.

Today, Juneteenth is a call-to-action for all of us across the country to come together, and honor and continue the work of those before us who fought for Black lives, Black voices, and Black votes.  We will have the opportunity to envision a path forward, as we acknowledge the legacy of Juneteenth in Galveston, Texas!

- - - - -

[The dates scheduled after Juneteenth are introductory workshops and updates to the national unification project.]

__The Juneteenth Guidance and National Action Plan__ resources will be distributed during the event presentations on June 18-19, 2023.  The National Action Plan will include outreach to federal-state legislatures with a connective message about the historic relevance of Juneteenth to current legislation.  _Any-all dates-times scheduled prior to June 18-19, 2023 are in advance preparation of the Juneteenth ABCDEs.™_  __The dates scheduled after Juneteenth are for additions and progress updates on the Juneteenth ABCDEs.™__

ADVANCE PREPARATION:  __The Juneteenth ABCDEs™__ for national acknowledgements, benefits, commercialization, dedications, and education to constructively memorialize-highlight the most impactful goals to nationalize-unify and progress-promote the visions of Juneteenth for all Americans.  Please complete and submit a thoughtful-detailed plan description for national unification to have your ideas and submissions included in __the final national unification work product__ ... (one paragraph, a few sentences is sufficient).  This is an ongoing project with scheduled meeting updates.

#Juneteenth #JuneteenthABCDEs

- - - - -

This is the reason Democracy Matters! and 2020 Victorious! | Communities United are hosting our Juneteenth Weekend of Action from Friday-Monday, June 16-19, 2023. We are calling on you to participate by organizing voter education-registration-empowerment drives in your local community!

DEMOCRACY MATTERS! is counting on all of us to participate by registering our colleagues-neighbors, families-friends and communities to ensure that eligible voters check and update their voter registration status during the National Voter Registration Year of Action. We are calling on you to participate by registering your friends, family, and neighbors, and helping eligible voters check and update their voter registration.

Head over to a high traffic area in your community (laundromat, grocery store, barbershop, etc.) to register voters, make it a part of your family reunion or cookout with friends, or set up a voter registration table at a local Juneteenth celebration in your community. Whatever you’re doing – make registering voters a key part of it!

Saving our democracy has never been led by the people in power – it’s been led by each one of us, and it starts in our communities.

160 million Americans cast their ballots in 2020 – shattering voter turnout records and making history. And we can’t stop now. There is still work to be done before we head #BacktotheBallotBox!

ELECTION PROTECTION HOTLINE: Telephone or Text 866-OUR-VOTE (866-687-8683) * Tweet @866OURVOTE

Copyright © 2021-2023 Communities United | 2020 Victorious!

title: Voter ID Assistance Orientation - Help voters get the ID the need to cast a ballot that counts!
description:
## VoteRiders is seeking dedicated virtual and in-person volunteers to provide free voter ID assistance to eligible voters in key communities where VoteRiders has staff on the ground including *Houston (TX), Columbus (GA), Pittsburgh (PA), Orlando (FL) and Charlotte (NC), Madison (WI), Milwaukee (WI) and Atlanta (GA)*.

This unique opportunity will make an immediate impact and directly help folks secure the ID they need to cast a ballot that counts. 

Are you detail-oriented, reliable, computer savvy, and passionate about people? We need you for this ongoing opportunity!

### How you can help: 

Provide virtual and, if convenient, in-person ID help to people who have requested assistance, through our partners or self-referral. Work one-on-one with voters on your schedule!  (Requirement:  1-3 hours per week).

** Volunteers will need to attend at least one buddy training after this call.  Attend this orientation to receive sign-up information for buddy training.

title: Social Bio Workshop
description: Social Bio Workshop every first Saturday. Family members and friends of defendants come together to work on their cases. We analyze documents and create social biography packets that include photos, character letters, videos, grades, certificates, pay stubs — anything that reveals the defendant’s good qualities, the support of loved ones, and ties to the community. The packets enable judges, prosecutors, probation officers, and the public to see a human being rather than merely a case number or a list of charges.

description: Come join us for our May BIC meeting.  The meeting will be held on Monday, May 12, 2025 at Zorba's Greek Restaurant in the Seven Oaks Shopping Center.  The meeting starts promptly at 6:30 and ends at 7:30.  To get a good seat please arrive early.  The room capacity is 50 people.  We have a social hour which begins at 5:30 and ends at 6:30 during which you can order food and drinks and socialize with your neighbors. If you plan to order food or drinks, it is suggested that you arrive prior to 5:30.  Stay as long as you like afterward to socialize.  Our guest speaker will be Councilman Derrek Pugh, representing Richland County District 2. title: Floridians For Immigrant Justice Know Your Rights Team Meeting
description:
Join our Floridians For Immigrant Justice Know Your Rights Team meeting on the second Tuesday of every month.  

We will strategize on how to best inform and educate our impacted immigrant communities on exercising their rights, and be prepared when interacting with law enforcement agencies. 

Let's mobilize together to build strong and informed communities that uplift and empower immigrants in Florida!

title: Postcarding & Political Conversation
description:
We strive to build community, educate voters, and use our Sharpies to write to save democracy together. Join us 9:30am to 12pm ET, to write postcards, talk about the races, and hear from candidates and political leaders. 

Please answer the registration questions accurately and completely. If this is your first time joining this group, please sign on by 9:45am ET. Compliance with these requests will facilitate admission to our Zoom meeting.

Write postcards with us or just join the conversation. If you need help getting started with postcarding, please visit our [FAQ](https://markersfordemocracy.org/postcarding/postcarding-faq).

If you are with the media and want to attend, you must notify us at markersfordemocracy@gmail.com at least two hours before the start of the event. All discussions are off the record.

This event is co-hosted by [Markers For Democracy](https://markersfordemocracy.org), [Downtown Nasty Women Social Group](https://linktr.ee/DNWSG), and [Team Min](https://linktr.ee/teammin
).

title: Life After Release Free Expungement Clinic Every 1st Saturday of the month.

address_lines: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details
location.venue: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details

description:
Life After Release will hold an expungement clinic Saturday, September 2nd, 2023 from 1 p.m. to 3 p.m. The clinic will take place at Creative Suitland located at 4719 Silver Hill Road Suitland, Maryland 20746.  

The criminal records expungement clinic is a chance for members of the community to meet with an attorney to have their criminal records expunged. The goal is to have a petition for expungement drawn up after meeting with an attorney. 

This event has been successful in the past, and we’re looking forward to this one. It provides the opportunity for people to walk away on the road to having certain criminal charges off their record. The only requirement is that these be Maryland residence, with the tenacity to see the process through. There might be further qualifications to have a record expunged, but that is what the attorneys are there to assist people in determining. 

YOU MUST BE REGISTERED TO RECEIVE SERVICES! 

If you are a member of the media and have questions about this, please contact Life After Release at 240.200.4472 or lifeafterreleasemd@gmail.com.

title: National Voter Education-Registration-Empowerment Year of Action | Communities United
description:
2020 Victorious! | Communities United is conducting a National Voter Mobilization-Education-Registration-Empowerment Year of Action to get our communities prepared and #VoteReady to promote #VoterEducation from __January 1, 2024 to December 31, 2024.__  This is a national conversation on how we can all work together every year to expand our collective mission to protect democracy, fight voter suppression, and ensure all Americans have equal access to the ballot box.  This is democracy and it requires action.

- - - - - - - - - -

__Training Session:__ (outline update)

* Basic Voter Education-Registration ... (30-minutes, ends 7:30pm) ... review resources in advance, arrive on-time, prepare-ask questions, take notes
* Brave New Films: "Suppressed and Sabotaged" | The Right/Fight to Vote [(trailer)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_RhrbEh-osI) ... (45-minutes, ends 8:15pm) ... prepare to be attentive, note impressionable incidents, remarkable statements
* Advance Voter Mobilization-Empowerment ... (30-minutes, ends 8:45pm) ... bring experiences-questions, take notes. take action

- - - - - - - - - -

We are inviting you to join 2020 Victorious! | Communities United for National Voter Mobilization-Education-Registration-Empowerment Year of Action to get our communities prepared and #VoteReady to promote #VoterEducation from __January 1, 2024 to December 31, 2024.__ We are counting on you to participate by organizing and supporting [in-person/virtual] voter registration drives where you will register eligible voters, and help experienced voters check-confirm and update their registration.

This year's target campaign will champion a call-to-action for: ... (to be updated)

Last year's target campaign will champion a call-to-action for:

__National Voter Registration Day__ - Tuesday, September 17, 2024

__National Voter Education Week of Action__ - Sunday, September 15-22, 2024

__National Voter Education Week__ - Monday-Friday, October 7-11, 2024

__Vote Early Day Celebration!__ - Tuesday, October 29, 2024


__Launch a Community Conversation__ in your neighborhood-network! Let’s create a truly democratic space where we can connect together through meaningful dialogue.  __Note:__ The national acknowledgement date may differ from the date of meeting-discussion.

Advance Preparation: Organize a personal list of colleagues-neighbors, family-friends eligible to vote in the battleground-swing states below: then write a brief statement to motivate-inform the recipients.  This discussion is for immediate participation in the call-to-action to protect our democracy.

__Battleground-Swing States:__ AK-Alaska, AZ-Arizona, FL-Florida, GA-Georgia, KS-Kansas, MI-Michigan, NC-North Carolina, NV-Nevada, NY-New York, OH-Ohio, PA-Pennsylvania, SC-South Carolina, TX-Texas, WI-Wisconsin ... (governor, secretary of state, senator, congress)

_Relational Organizing in the battleground-swing states._

- - - - -

__Suppressed and Sabotaged: The Fight to Vote,__ a powerful 2020 Brave New Films production documentary about the growing threat of voter suppression and election sabotage to our 2023 midterm-year elections.  There will be multiple documentary series presented throughout the year. [(movie trailer)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_RhrbEh-osI&t=1s)

* Monday-Friday, October 7-11, 2024 - __National Voter Education Week__
* Documentary Screening, _upon advance request *_ [(movie trailer)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_RhrbEh-osI&t=1s)

__Preparation:__ We will organize our creative inspirations-skills to design several written expressions that capture the spirit of the national holiday for a monthly targeted campaign. The inspirational expressions will be distributed nationally to promote the advancement of voting rights throughout our respective communities.  This will include the development of a voting toolkit of best practices.  The community feedback provided by-to attendee-participants will guide-improve the collective voter mobilization-education-registration-empowerment response.

__GETTING STARTED__

__A Simple Task:__  Ask your community networks of colleagues-neighbors and family-friends to check the status of their voter registration at VOTE.gov or VOTE.org ... (and ask that they pass it on to their networks).  _"Check your voter registration status at VOTE.gov or VOTE.org and ask your networks to do the same."_

__National Voter Mobilization-Education-Registration-Empowerment Year of Action is a call to action.__

* THE GOAL: Engage at least 3-5+ potential voters in 5-days of action!
* Ambitious Goal:  Engage at least 20-25+ potential voters in 5-days of action!

__Immediate Next Steps:__ Early Voting [(calendar)](https://www.vote.org/early-voting-calendar/) - Mail-In Ballot [(rules)](https://www.vote.org/absentee-voting-rules/) - Sample Ballot [(guide)](https://www.usa.gov/voter-research) - Invite your colleagues-neighbors, family-friends, and community networks to be mobilized and educated about the issues that most impact them.  Include the early voting locations-dates-times, mail-in ballot instructions, and sample ballot previews information links in your personal distributions to ensure election day preparedness.

National Voter Education Week [(NVEW)](https://www.votereducationweek.org) strives to help voters overcome common barriers to become confident voters and ambassadors of voting in their own communities for every election and provides days-of-action and voting resources.

Learn how to register the 4-million youth voters who will become eighteen and eligible to vote this year, the 30-million Americans who moved and need to update their voter registration, the 2-million Americans living abroad (required to verify status annually), the 2-million Americans who got married (and changed their names) and need to update their voter registration, and the millions of Americans purged from the voter registration rolls for simple and avoidable reasons.

ELECTION PROTECTION HOTLINE: Call or Text 866-OUR-VOTE * Tweet @866OURVOTE

- - - - -

__5 Days | 5 Actions__ National Voter Education Week (NVEW) helps voters bridge the gap between registering to vote and actually casting a ballot. During this week of interactive education, voters have the opportunity to find their polling location, understand their ballot, make a plan to vote in person or remotely, and more. NVEW strives to help voters overcome common barriers to become confident voters and ambassadors of voting in their own communities for every election.  Review the NVEW website to become familiar with the days-of-action and other voting resources. [(... more NVEW)](https://www.votereducationweek.org)

__Optional Task:__  VoteRiders is seeking dedicated virtual volunteers to help manage voter appointments and rides to the DMV and other ID-issuing agencies on an ongoing weekly basis. Responsibilities include making appointment reminder calls, scheduling rides and handling communications between drivers and voters. No experience is necessary.  VoteRiders will provide all of the training and support needed to be successful. This opportunity is ideal for volunteers living in the Central Time Zone or Eastern Time Zone as the voters we help most frequently live in North Carolina, Georgia, Florida and Texas. [(... more VoteRiders)](https://www.voteriders.org)

__12 Months | 21 Actions__ National Voter Mobilization-Education-Registration-Empowerment Year (NVMEREY) helps voters bridge the gap between registering to vote and actually casting a ballot. During this year of interactive education, voters have the opportunity to find their polling location, understand their ballot, make a plan to vote in person or remotely, and more. NVMERY strives to help voters overcome common barriers to become confident voters and ambassadors of voting in their own communities for every election.

While National Voter Mobilization-Education-Empowerment Year of Action is a __TARGETED campaign__ scheduled for a full extended year, the __Call-to-Action__ can begin today and continue any-every month-day throughout the year.  We will meet, as a collective, on the designated dates-times above to discuss our daily encounters-progress and brainstorm ideas!

A few great places to host voter registration drives include: local businesses (ask customers-employees to distribute-share the links), places of worship (ask to get a table in the lobby after services), the business office workplace (talk to each colleague to get them to update their registration), your high school or college-university (set-up a table in a high-traffic area or talk to fellow students during breakfast-lunch), and high-traffic areas in your community (laundromats, playgrounds, public parks, restaurants, supermarkets), etc.

- - - - -

2020 Victorious! | Communities United is counting on all of us to participate by registering our colleagues-neighbors, families-friends and communities to ensure that eligible voters check and update their voter registration status during National Voter Mobilization-Education-Registration-Empowerment Year of Action.  We are calling on you to participate by registering your friends, family, and neighbors, and helping eligible voters check and update their voter registration.

Begin by thinking of several dates and places that you can integrate voter registration into your schedule, including the places that you will already be! Think about the gatherings you already attend, and places where you regularly have conversations with others.  RSVP to this event page to indicate that during the Year of Action, you will participate by registering voters in your neighborhood and help your colleagues-neighbors, families-friends and communities check and update their voter registration!

160 million Americans cast their ballots in 2020 – shattering voter turnout records and making history.  And we can’t stop now.  There is still work to be done before we are #VoteReady!

title: Food Scraps Collection: El Nido Farmers' Market
description:
As a volunteer, you’ll be right in the action, collecting food scraps from market-goers—the first step in a crucial process that turns waste into nutrient-rich compost. These scraps, gathered at local markets, are then processed at nearby green parks or gardens. Throughout your shift, you'll be guided by an experienced LA Compost staff member, who will act as your Compost Manager, offering insights and helping you share the benefits of composting with the public. The best part is that during your volunteer shift, you can take some time to shop at the market. Join us and be part of the composting movement that's transforming LA—one food scrap at a time!

#### ABOUT ACTIVITY:
As a volunteer, you’ll play a hands-on role in guiding market-goers through composting, ensuring their food scraps are clean of stickers, compostable, and ready to be turned into nutrient-rich compost. You’ll monitor for contamination, assist with tracking data, and serve as a friendly, welcoming host to our composting community. 

#### MORE INFO: 
* You'll be stationed at the LA Compost booth under a pop-up canopy within the farmers' market. There will also be seating available.
* You may be asked to assist with moving filled bins of material weighing 60+ pounds. We always offer team lifts; you will never be asked to lift bins if you prefer not to.
* No prior composting experience is needed; everyone is welcome!
* Bathrooms are NOT available
* If you sign up, please show up! We rely on volunteers like you to achieve our mission.  
* We’ll follow up with details via email, so be sure to provide your best contact email when signing up.

#### AGE REQUIREMENT:
This volunteer activity is best suited for volunteers aged 16 and up. Minors under 16 should come accompanied by a parent or guardian unless other arrangements are made. Contact ashleigh@lacompost.org for more information.

#### IMPORTANT: VOLUNTEER WAIVER
Please make sure you have signed the volunteer waiver. 
Access the e-wavier at https://www.lacompost.org/waiver

title: Vote Early Day Celebration! | Communities United
description:
__Vote Early Day is Thursday, October 26, 2023,__ and our team is excited to see what kind of fun and engaging celebrations you have planned for your community! How you celebrate is ultimately up to you, but for some inspiration, check out the Vote Early Day [(toolkit)](https://voteearlyday.org/toolkit/).

As you work to build a successful celebration, consider the following:

__Encourage ballot research and plan making.__ 
Everywhere in America, eligible voters can research their ballots and make a plan to vote. Our partners are steering voters to resources to identify options to vote early or on election day.

__Throw a party or parade.__
Through parties at the polls and community parades to early voting sites, organizations across the country will inspire more Americans to vote early. Even in states without in-person early voting, friends can come together to fill-in their mail-in ballots.

__Spread the word.__
Through mass on-air or digital marketing, media companies will teach Americans how to vote early by pointing them to local events and resources to cast their ballots.

__Attend-Host an event.__
Flagship events across the country will feature major talent, local election administrators, and thousands of voters.

With November right around the corner, today is a perfect time to start thinking about how you will encourage your colleagues-neighbors, family-friends and communities to vote early by celebrating Vote Early Day on October 26, 2023!

Copyright © 2021-2023 Communities United | 2020 Victorious!

title: Movement Labs - Weekly Volunteer Training
description:
Movement Labs works with a diverse mix of progressive candidates and campaigns that are working to build a better country. Our volunteer texting team (13,000+ strong) helps move people to take action in their local communities.

This training is aimed at new texting volunteers, and we'll cover how to get started texting with us.

If you already text with us but would like a quick brush-up or have questions you'd like answers to, join us!

We're happy to answer any texting questions you might have! The goal of these trainings is to help your text workflow be as easy as possible!

So don't wait; sign up now!

title: Compost Hub Support: Cottonwood Urban Farm
description:
At our Compost Hubs, food scraps collected from the community are transformed into nutrient-rich compost, and we need your help to make it happen! As a Compost Hub Support Volunteer, you’ll gain hands-on experience working alongside our knowledgeable Compost Managers. Get ready to leave feeling accomplished, a little sweaty, and brimming with new compost knowledge. 

#### ABOUT ACTIVITY:
Roll up your sleeves and dive into a variety of engaging activities—whether it’s managing a three-bin system, tending to a compost pile, sifting finished compost, or exploring a mix of everything. There’s something for everyone, from beginners to seasoned pros! Plus, our Compost Hubs are situated in LA County’s most cherished green spaces: community gardens, urban farms, and beautiful parks. Join passionate community composters, learn to turn food scraps into rich compost, and connect with the local food system. 

#### MORE INFO: 
* You will be working outdoors! Shade levels vary by site.
* Activities level can be adjusted to your comfort and abilities—just communicate with your Compost Manager.
* No prior composting experience is needed; everyone is welcome!
* No Bathrooms are available
* If you sign up, we ask that you show up! We rely on volunteers, like you, to achieve our mission.  
* We’ll follow up with details via email, so be sure to provide your best contact email when signing up.

#### AGE REQUIREMENT:
This volunteer activity is best suited for volunteers aged 16 and up. Minors under the age of 16 should come accompanied by a parent or guardian unless other arrangements are made. Contact ashleigh@lacompost.org for more information.

#### IMPORTANT: VOLUNTEER WAIVER
Please make sure you have signed the volunteer waiver. 
Access the e-Wavier at https://www.lacompost.org/waiver

ANIMALS ONSITE: Please be aware that volunteering at this site may involve being in the presence of various animals, including but not limited to honeybees, poultry, cats, and dogs.

description:
We must organize to have the schools our children deserve!

Over the last year, EPISD has been making decisions without our input and playing with our children’s future. They are using their power to exert their values into our schools. But it doesn't have to be this way.

Amanecer People’s Project is a community based, power building organization. We are part of the Save Our Schools Coalition. We are committed to doing the long term work needed to make sure that public institutions work FOR the people so it’s our needs and interests that guide decisions.

title: Analyzing the Issues That Motivate Voters | Communities United
description:
Many factors can __motivate people to participate in elections.__ Some of the most common reasons include a desire to have their voices heard, a belief that their vote can make a difference, a sense of civic duty, a disposition about political issues (personal values), or a desire to support a particular candidate or party.

With the __midterm and national elections__ happening every year, and __state primary and special elections__ happening nearly every month, we will analyze-discuss not only _how_ will Americans vote, but also _why_ they are planning to vote that way.

The new national polls that examine the electorate in an effort to understand what exactly is motivating voters to vote will be reviewed. The studies of both Democratic likely voters and Republican likely voters reveal that voters are animated by either party values or economic issues.  The question is whether state and national elections are determined by either of the major parties or by a larger majority of Independent voters.

Those are the broad overviews, but the devil in the details is always the voter turnout. At the end of the day, in this case, Election Day, the key is __motivating voters to cast their ballots.__  Voter turnout is essential, if not the most important, key to winning an election. 

The __"Analyze the Issues that Motivate Voters"__ event program _requires_ advance preparation-knowledge and is intended for voters with voter registration knowlege-experiences.  This event program is not a basic voter registration presentation.

*** NEW ***

Q: Are you prepared to Motivate Registered Voters? ... (review upon registration confirmation)

Review "National Voter Education-Registration-Empowerment Year of Action" [(mobilization)](www.mobilize.us/2020victorious/event/580830/) and _all referenced links._

The 2024 Election season will include innovative community-based organizing with a national program platform to engage networks in local-regional-state-national communities to educate-register-mobilize voters for state-by-state 'down-ballot' and primary-presidential elections, and to reclaim the U.S. House of Representatives, expand the U.S. Senate, and secure the White House for the democracy we deserve.

This program is a practical-functional skills training in community outreach and having persuasive conversations with colleagues-neighbors, family-friends and community networks, using relational organizing and community outreach to motivate all voters (frequent-infrequent) — we are excited to start organizing together!

- - - - -

- - - - -

160 million Americans cast their ballots in 2020 – shattering voter turnout records and making history.  And we can’t stop now.  There is still work to be done before we are #VoteReady!

ELECTION PROTECTION HOTLINE: Call or Text 866-OUR-VOTE * Tweet @866OURVOTE

Copyright © 2021-2023 Communities United | 2020 Victorious!

title: Kitchen Prep

address_lines: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details
location.venue: This event’s address is private. Sign up for more details

description:
HELLO VOLUNTEERS!
At Feed Louisville, we often say that volunteers are the backbone of our organization. With help from people like you, we sent out 145,000 meals in 2023 to the houseless and food insecure community. Join us in the kitchen to help our team turn donated food into nutritious meals! From prepping vegetables, making sandwiches, packaging meals, and much more, there is plenty to help with!

SHIFTS
There are two volunteer time slots to choose from; 9 am to 12 pm and/or 1 pm to 3:30 pm. If you need to come a little late or leave a little early, no problem at all. Sign up for the shift your schedule best aligns with!

DRESS GUIDELINES
When volunteering in our kitchen, we ask you to dress comfortably and appropriately! Open-toed shoes or dangling jewelry are not permitted as they pose a risk to your safety. It is best to wear non-slip shoes, bring a hat or bandana, and keep your hair tied back. Aprons and gloves will be provided!

GROUPS
If you want to bring a group of 10 or more, please email volunteer@feedlouisville.org so we can work with you to schedule a date that works best!

LOCATION
Our kitchen is at 1334 Story Avenue Louisville, KY. Please read these directions before coming to volunteer!

If driving on Story Ave, the entrance to our parking lot is directly across from the Whirling Tiger, at the corner of Webster and Story. Enter through the open black gates on your left, drive until you come to the T in the road, then turn right. Drive towards the yellow dumpster at the end and enter our parking lot surrounded by a chain link fence. 

If driving on North Spring Street, take a left at the Louisville Division Fire Station 3 and keep driving straight to the yellow dumpster and chain link fenced area. 

After parking, walk towards the building, and up the wooden stairs. Continue until you see a door that says "Social Events and Feed Louisville". Once inside, walk towards the double doors and turn right. Go through the white doors and around the bend to the volunteer station!

If you have trouble finding us, please call or text us at 502-418-7443 or 859-638-0237 and we will gladly guide you in the right direction!

SAFETY AND AGE REQUIREMENTS
For safety reasons, we do not allow persons under 10 years of age to volunteer in our kitchen. Volunteers from 10 to 14 years old must be accompanied by an adult and will be assigned to non-kitchen tasks. Those 14 to 18 years old may be allowed to use knives or work around industrial kitchen equipment, depending on their experience level. Anyone 18 years and older can work in our production kitchen.

THANK YOU
We are grateful for your willingness to help us in our mission to rescue more food and put it into the hands of the houseless and food insecure in Louisville. If you cannot make it to our kitchen, consider sharing our story and the work of our community partners on social media, or consider donating to increase the number of people we can feed!

Looking forward to meeting you,
Caitlyn Morgan
Expo and Volunteer Coordinator

reach out to volunteer@feedlouisville.org with any questions!

description:

2. **Check your email and text for further instructions that will direct you to:**

title: Postcarding & Political Conversation
description:
We strive to build community, educate voters, and use our Sharpies to write to save democracy together. Join us 10am to 12pm ET, to write postcards, talk about the races, and hear from candidates and political leaders. 

Please answer the registration questions accurately and completely. If this is your first time joining this group, please sign on by 10:15am ET. Compliance with these requests will facilitate admission to our Zoom meeting.

Write postcards with us or just join the conversation. If you need help getting started with postcarding, please visit our [FAQ](https://markersfordemocracy.org/postcarding/postcarding-faq).

If you are with the media and want to attend, you must notify us at markersfordemocracy@gmail.com at least two hours before the start of the event. All discussions are off the record.

This event is co-hosted by [Markers For Democracy](https://markersfordemocracy.org), [Downtown Nasty Women Social Group](https://linktr.ee/DNWSG), and [Team Min](https://linktr.ee/teammin
).

title: Hennepin County Court Watch
description:
Court watching is a tactic to raise public awareness about our legal system and to hold the system accountable through witnessing, documenting, and sharing experiences at bail hearings. This is a powerful and critical tool for organizing because so much harm is never witnessed and goes unchecked. Court watching is a tool of PEOPLE POWER against those in power. 

MN Freedom Funds court watching is a volunteer-based program aimed at shining a light on Ramsey County and Hennepin County Arraignment hearings. This is where money bail decisions are made and ultimately, people's access to pretrial freedom is determined.​

Hennepin County Court Watch Shifts are every 1st Thursday and every 2nd Monday of the month at 1:30 pm. 

Ramsey County Court Watch Shifts every 4th Monday of the month at 9:00am

*These dates are subject to change*
